stories.text:
Context:

I got caught in this classic heated debate on Twitter https://twitter.com/heydonworks/status/1429021526221852680

People got all tribal about it and touchy as always, and even though many of the authors followers who said that HTML and CSS are programming languages and that they should be enough for getting a job, even tho most people are agreeing with him, he still had to resort to throwing insults my way.

https://twitter.com/heydonworks/status/1429166991110193157
stories.title: Is saying that HTML and CSS are not Programming Languages Gatekeeping?
GM Recalls All Chevy Bolt Electric Vehicles
Clubhouse removed personal info from users’ accounts in Afghanistan

stories.text: I have seen managers become a co-author in any patent their team file. This undermine the principle of a patent that the person coming up with the idea should only file a patent. I know people who have tens of patent but they don't know anything about them as the person is just a manager and anybody in the team file a patent they have to add the manager.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why in FAANG companies a manager becomes patent co-author?
